These people, while friendly enough, do not put love into their overpriced wraps.
author: Skeptical Spee ..

description: This place has the FRESHEST awesomest food!!! Lunch was amazing!! The decor and atmosphere was comforting!! This place is a must! And did I mention how great the staff is??? Everything is clean and organized everything is cooked right in front of u!!! It's a MUST to eat here!!
author: Tami S.

description: The falafel wrap was packed with flavor. It was delicious and I am picky about my falafel. The beef and lamb gyro was out of this world. I love this place. Too bad Oasis Grill does not have branch in Los Angles
author: Ankeen T.

description:
The service was excellent. Very friendly and our food came quick. 

I had the gyro. The meat was tasty and there was enough, but not too much, veggies. 

However, there was too much of the wrap and not enough meat, so it seemed a little dry. I wish they gave more meat. I'm not a local, so if I want another gyro, I'm going to try elsewhere.
author: Daniel S.

description: Quality is fine, but quantity to price ratio was low.
author: Quinn S.

description: Good food, rude staff, first time I went there I was ordering in Arabic, this time the guy refused to talk to me in Arabic and treaded me in a very rude way!!!!
author: Mimo A.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the chicken spicy shawarma. I would definitely get it again. It is a little bit on the dry side but they add sauce to it to make up for the chicken dryness. Priced about right and filling.
author: David S.

description:
My husband ordered his wrap to go. His wrap was a faucet of runny yogurt sauce, splattering on the sidewalk and ruining his black trousers. He had to hold the wrap over a trash can to finish it while we tried to wipe his black trousers clean with diaper wipes. It didn't work. We didn't attempt to wipe the trail of yogurt sauce behind us. 

The kebab itself tasted terrible. Low-grade meat. Nice and soggy thanks to the yogurt bath.
author: Zara Y.

description: Fresh food and healthy, the platters and wraps taste authentic and does not taste like fast food. The protien and greens combination are very balanced. Even the fries taste fresh. The place needs ambience improvement because its too bright and white but overall, the food is really superb.
author: James Y.

description: They should know Americans refer to a gyro as lamb/ beef in a pita not a lavish. A lavish makes it a shawerma to us.
author: H K.

description: Do u like shwarma that are half the size as the other place? If so come here, this new place sucks!!!
author: christopher h.

description:
Extremely mediocre and overpriced food. I came in craving a light lunch and just ordered a Shish Taouk plate. The amount of shishtaouk I got is comical considering I just paid around $14 and some change for this. The portion size for the rice is equally hysterical, not that it matter because the rice is bland and does not have any traditional middle eastern spices to it (in fact, there is corn and carrots of all things, in it.)

Now legitimately more half of this so-called platter is a giant ass helping of tzaziki sauce, hot sauce and a truly subpar attempt at Shepard salad ( the finely diced cucumber and tiny-barely-there-tomato pieces taste so bland and not fresh like someone did not even bother to try). I can't stand when I pay for something and not get what I paid for and mind you, I do not even eat big proportions and wasn't even hungry when I came in here. That salad could've at least used some dill and olives -- jeez how can anyone label their cooking mediteranean and sell it like that.

To seal the deal, the hummus is equally bland in both flavor and texture which made munching on the generic pita they served seem like the way to go.
author: Mia F.

description: Went here for lunch. I was sad it replaced Del Taco but I love Mediterranean food and was eager to check out the new kid on the block. The salads looked really good so I decided to get the Mezza platter with chicken on the side. The falafel and dolmas were solid, but the rest of the options were just whatever. Three of the salads were underdressed/not dressed at all and the tzatziki was also missing something (flavor). The biggest disappointment was the chicken. It looked tasty and well seasoned, but when I tried it, it was dry and bland. Definitely not worth the extra $6. If I go back, I'd stick to the vegetarian options.
author: Christy K.

description: Love this place! Excellent cooked beef and chicken. Large portions and they include bread and rice, salad, hummus, tzatziki dip and the meat of your choosing. They get you in and out with good tasting food. They don't have a lot of seating. I love this places great food of excellent quality and good service.
author: Jannet H.

description: No stretching the truth by mixing yoghurt in Tahini.  Just super fresh Middle Eastern foods (wraps, salads, signature plates with fresh, thoughtfully seasoned meats or falafels) that will keep you and your friends returning... Like us!  Grateful counter service....the work team shows authentic warmth and dedication to make each order perfecto!
author: Paula H.

description: This place is not authentic but I don't know if they claim to be. I can't stop thinking about the spicy falafel wrap I had for lunch and dinner (they're huge). Amazing flavors and unlike a lot of other places, they make their falafel from scratch. The sauces are so flavorful!
author: Daisy A.

description: A-OK! I was wasted one night needed something quick and semi healthy, this was perfect! I ordered the falafel wrap everything in it was very fresh! I would come back for sure!
author: Karen T.

description: Amateur hour here. No TLC or respect for what they're makibg, at least none based on my lackluster Greek salad. A bunch of ingredients thrown together and drowned in sauce. Ugh. Waste of my $13 (I added chicken).
author: Tyler M.

description: go to the drumm st. location . This place isn't even close. There are no lines at this location for a reason.
author: Ted J.

description: I used to visit this location once a week. But after my recent visit, I won't go there anymore. There was a guy with broken arm behind the counter yelling after his colleagues, not wearing plastic gloves while touching the food, produce, fridge, oven.... He gave me a bit of attitude and a 'fake smile.' So no, I'm not coming back to this location, and if you're unhappy with your work, just leave. Do not give attitude to the guests. And keep your fake smile for your fake friends!!
author: Andrea K.

description: I ordered the chicken shawarma and fries. Overall, the food was good but the chicken shawarma could have used a little less sauce and the fries, a little less salt. The staff were friendly and the wait was reasonable.
author: DE M.

description: Fatoush Salad was gross.  Tasted like a rubber glove and had a refrigerated flavor.  Will not be going back.  I can get much better for $13.00
author: Diana R.

description: Love this place! Good food, friendly service and fast. The beef and lamb gyro is my favourite but I also love the combo platter. You can sit down or to go. Just make sure you indicate spicy or not clearly because they sometimes forget.
author: Anthony Y.

description: The Greek salad here is an abomination.  One-quarter of the lettuce was brown, one-quarter of the lettuce was romaine cores and the rest was okay.  I think I had one ounce of feta and the olives are the kind you get in a can that are pre-sliced.  They should call this an American salad.  Tasteless and definitely not worth the money.  Although this is in the block where I work, I won't go back.
author: Susan L.

description: The people working there were friendly and polite. I got the lamb gyro it was delicious, fresh and healthy. I would certainly come back if I'm in the area.
author: Jared B.

description:
This place was soo needed on market fresh healthy Mediterranean food. Everyone is real nice and device is great. The food is awesome. I got beef shawarma it was great.
The place looks real nice. This is my new favorite place
author: Deango R.

description: really good shawarma,  the reason I am giving it 4 stars that it's kinda pricy for a shawarma ,,,i will definitely be back again.
author: Mo Yasin Y.

description: Great halal food in a busy part of town, that being said seating is limited so best for on the go or may get lucky to find a spot to grab a bite inside.  The food is delicious and service is timely, For lunch tried the beef / lamb Sharma plate and had a good balance of meat, rice, hummus, salad, and sauce... left full and happy :)
author: S H.

description: New to town and wanted to try this place. Took FOREVER to get my food ready and when I got it the amount of food was ridiculously small and was so disappointed at the quality of the food especially with them being pricy. Never going back!!!!
author: Noha H.

description: they have good and affordable kabobs, falafel wraps. reliable fast middle eastern food.
author: Jess T.
